iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Voice for indigenous communities
iati-activity.description: Voice for indigenous communities, building 36 radio networks in Oxaca State through experts.

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Mexico

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The objective is to support free organising of metal workers as well as trade union movement that is based on the rights of workers by establishing democratic and company-based trade unions or by democratising the protection unions.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Grizelda Alvarez_ Women in Local Politics . The NGO Grizelda Alvarez works with women in local government level giving them training on how to take gender and equality issues into account in their work in the public sector. Work focuses on areas outside Mexico City where the gender issues are still less known and understood. The NGO also trains women to become trainers_ gives workshops to men and builds and maintains a nationwide women empowerment network.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: YIRTRAK A.C. / Sustainable development of Rural Communities . The NGO YIRTRAK works for the improvement of the availibility_ quality and treatment of water and forests in rural areas of Chiapas. The aim is to help the local population to adapt sustainable manner of dealing with the natural resources that surround them. The NGO works both with the communities and local schools giving training on the issue. They will also build wood-saving stoves in the villages. The project lasts two years.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Strengthening of forest owners_ organizations in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Aim: Contribute poverty reduction in forest areas through building up capacity of individual and communal forest owners; promote sustainable utilization of forest resources. Beneficiaries; Forest owners associations at national_ state and local level_ 670 000 forest owners. Activities: Capacity building of forest owners associations; development of services provided to forest owners_ incl. information concerning markets and prices_ and training and material about appropriate technology in silviculture and forest harvesting.

location.name: Mexico_ Perote region_ State of Veracruz

iati-activity.title: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) from Finland to Mexico
iati-activity.description: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) from Finland to Mexico

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Enhancing autonomous and sustainable use of forests and promoting education
iati-activity.description: Enhancing autonomous and sustainable use of forests and promoting education of agroforestry in the territories of Wixarika people in the community of Santa Catarina.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Asesores / Sustainable Rural Development: firewood saving, forestation. The project aims to tackle the issue of deforestation in the indigenious zone of Mazahua in Estado de Mexico. Within the 7 month long project 80 firewood saving owens are being built for the local community, whose members are also being trained on the use of them as well as on sustainability in general. Also, an area of 80 hectars will be reforestated.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: ContralorÃ­a Ciudadana / Civil rights and access to public information. The projects trains members of marginalized communities in the state of Veracruz in their basic civil rights such as right for education, for health services and, importantly, in right to access information regarding public decision making. The aim is to encourage the community members to a more active and informed participation on the public affairs.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: IMIFAP / Indigenous people's enterpreneurship. The project aims to enhance the living conditions and livelyhood of about 1250 indigenious people, of whom 70% women, by providing them with capacity training on entrepreneurial skills so that they could run their micro-businesses. The programme is based on developing both the practical and psykosocial skills of the participants. The basis of the training are the 50 indigenious people who are first trained to be able to disperse their skills in their respective communities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Sinaloa Universidad/ Indigenous people's culture and judiciary . The project provides the civil servants of Sinaloa area judiciary training on the Indigenous people's culture, language and customary law so that the right's and cultural background of those indigenous taken to the court of law are better understood and taken in the account in the court processes. A special focus is given to the rights of indigenous women.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Tanesque / Basic training in marginalized communities . The project focuses on finding new tools on bilingual and intercultural training in rural and marginalized communities in four states (Puebla, Chipas, Oaxaca, Distrito Federal) of Mexico. Within the project 16 young indigenous people are trained to work with the school children. Later on, and based on a diagnosis of the learning processes of a pilote group of children, learning material appropriate for bilingual learning and for those with learning difficulties is produced in the languages of NÃ¡huatl, Tseltal and Spanish. The project will last for three years.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: INED / Training on Bilingual Teaching . The NGO InnovaciÃ³n y Apoyo Educativo A.C. (INED) trains pre-school level teachers in techniques and methods of bilingual teaching in the state of Chiapas in 12 schools. The work includes improving the interaction between the parents and the school so that the problematics of the bilingualism are better understood by all parties.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project taking place in the state of Veracruz, in Mexico, is to promote active citizenship with focus on the citizen right of access to public information. The project analyses the mechanisms of citizen participation and promote various strategies of participation. Within the project committees of locals are founded to follow the activities of local governement and the state of Veracruz, and their work guided and supported. In addition to this citizen participation is encouraged through access to internet. The project has about 1000 direct beneficiaries, of which over 50% are indigenious.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: The project takes place in Sierra Tarahumara in the state of Chihuahua in Mexico and its aim is to promote ecological food production and improve the quality and cantity of food procuded in the region. The target group consists of both indigenous- and non-indigenous peoples of the region and it will have a positive impact on the lifes of 1400 people. Within the project systems of rain water collection, ecological toilets and solar energy drying systems are installed to communities. Also the project runs enviromental programs in schools for about 250 children.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: The project takes place in Mexico, Hidalgo, and its aim is to promote the organizational capacities of local indigenious women and highlight the environmental aspects of their livelyhood. Educational workshops are organized about environmental protection, water saving and hygiene with the aim of reducing health related problems. Rain water collection and cleaning systems, ecological toilets and systems for sewage management are built for the women. Direct benefiaries of the project are 50 women and their families.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: The project aims to support a group of 39 artisan women in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The project re-inforces the organizational skills of the women, organizes workshops on the design of textils, on the commerzialication of their products and on small business administration. The aim of the project is that the women become self-supporting in their business activities and can can sell their produdt according to the principles of fair trade. Within the project 41 firewood saving stoves are built.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: The project continues the work started in 2009 in a project, which aimed at promoting the sustainable use of forests and prevent the loss of forests in the indigenous area of Mazahua in the state Estado de Mexico. Within the project 160 firewood saving stoves are built in Mazahua households and an area of 100 hectares are reforested. Workshops on the protection of environment are organized and the participation of women in particular is encouraged. The project benefits four groups of indigenous peoples and lasts for a year.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Mexico
iati-activity.description: Unallocated. Will be allocated in 2010.

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term establishment in the target country (e.g. subsidiary, representative office, maintenance company)
